apollon.cf.settings.dashboard.desc: Welcome to your dashboard. Here is a simple box.

apollon.ap.welcome.title: Welcome to Apollon v1.0.0
apollon.ap.welcome.name: Apollon
apollon.ap.welcome.desc:
Apollon is now installed and ready to use! You're now using the best customizable theme for WordPress. The three steps below will set your website ready for the moon.
We hope you enjoy it!
apollon.ap.welcome.gettingstarted.title: Getting started
apollon.ap.welcome.gettingstarted.desc: Getting started with Apollon is as easy as the following three steps! Apollon is designed with "smart defaults" based on best practices, and backed by a team of folks who are passionate about your success. It's their number one priority.
apollon.ap.welcome.whatsnew.title: What's new
apollon.ap.welcome.whatsnew.desc: See what's new in version 1.0.0 of Apollon! If you need clarity on anything you see here, don't hesitate to contact support.
apollon.ap.welcome.credits.title: Credits
apollon.ap.welcome.credits.desc: Apollon is a part of the Olympus framework and backed by a dedicated team of in-house developers and a vibrant open source community. If you are interested in contributing please visit the GitHub Repository.
apollon.ct.apollon.intro.title: Apollon customizations
apollon.ct.apollon.rtfm.title: Read the manual
apollon.ct.apollon.outro.title: Build with ♥ for developers.
apollon.ct.general.title: General options
apollon.ct.general.designsystem.title: Design system
apollon.ct.general.designsystem.desc: Define here your website's design system through all these following options.
apollon.ct.general.stylesheet.title: CSS integration
apollon.ct.general.stylesheet.location.i: As inline CSS into the WP Head
apollon.ct.general.opengraph.title: Open Graph Protocol
apollon.ct.general.opengraph.desc: The Open Graph protocol enables theme to integrate your pages into Social Graph network tools. More details (opens a new tab)
apollon.ct.general.opengraph.enable.desc: Turn on to display Open Graph Protocol.
apollon.ct.general.colors.title: Colors
apollon.ct.general.colors.desc: Color distinguishes your brand and helps you create consistent experiences across products.
apollon.ct.general.colors.main.title: Main colors
apollon.ct.general.colors.main.desc: Main palette which is comprised of colors to bring boldness to your brand and used in logical ways throughout product and marketing to guide the eye and highlight the important bits.
apollon.ct.general.colors.main.primary.d: Used for primary actions, buttons, text links, for indicating progress and representing authentication.
apollon.ct.general.colors.main.secondary: Used for secondary actions, buttons, for indicating alternative actions.
apollon.ct.general.colors.main.neutral.d: Used for body text and headings.
apollon.ct.general.colors.secondary.desc: Secondary palette contains a variety of colors to keep things fresh and interesting.
Red is mainly used for backgrounds in messages and in error states to draw attention to important information or actions that are destructive or block workflow.
apollon.ct.general.colors.secondary.yell: Yellow indicates a warning or that progress is impeded.
apollon.ct.general.colors.secondary.gree: Green indicates success or to celebrate a win.
apollon.ct.general.colors.secondary.blue: Blue is used to indicate authentication, connectivity, or progress.
apollon.ct.general.colors.secondary.teal: Teal can typically be found in illustrations or as an accent color for components such a tags.
apollon.ct.general.colors.secondary.purp: Purple indicates help and support and is used in spotlight, buttons, messages, lozenges, and image callouts.
apollon.ct.general.colors.extended.title: Extended colors
apollon.ct.general.colors.extended.desc: The extended palette consists of all the useable tints and shades of each color in the palette. They are all numbered for easy reference. Usage of these colors varies depending on the touch point, but they come in handy for illustrations and components in product.
apollon.ct.general.navbars.title: Navbars
apollon.ct.general.navbars.desc: The navbar is one of the main web app components.
apollon.ct.general.navbars.height.title: Height (in pixels)
apollon.ct.general.grids.title: Grid
apollon.ct.general.grids.desc: The grid is the foundation for positioning elements onscreen. Designing to the grid helps create seamless, easy to follow experiences.
apollon.ct.general.grids.container.title: Container size
apollon.ct.general.grids.columngap.title: Column spacing
apollon.ct.general.grids.columngap.desc: Set the size of the gap between the grid columns.
apollon.ct.general.grids.gap.title: Row spacing
apollon.ct.general.grids.gap.desc: Set the size of the gap between the grid rows.
apollon.ct.general.grids.divider.title: Divider
apollon.ct.general.grids.divider.desc: Turn on to display a divider between columns.
apollon.ct.general.grids.matchheight.des: Turn on to match height between columns.
apollon.ct.general.logos.title: Logos
apollon.ct.general.logos.desc: Your brand and product logos are clear, impactful and recognizable. All carry your simple primary color palette with design variations.
apollon.ct.general.logos.default.title: Main logo
apollon.ct.general.logos.retina.title: Retina logo
apollon.ct.general.logos.maxwidth.title: Max width
apollon.ct.general.logos.maxheight.title: Max height
apollon.ct.general.logos.maxheight.desc: Defined in pixels (px). Please, set "auto" to let the browser define the height automatically.
apollon.ct.general.logos.slogan.title: Slogan
apollon.ct.general.logos.slogan.desc: Turn on to display slogan next to main logo.
apollon.ct.general.typography.title: Typography
apollon.ct.general.typography.fontstacks: Use sans serif fonts for most of your type in-product, the exception being when you want to display code then you should defer to monospace fonts.
apollon.ct.general.typography.formatting: Text sizes, styles, and layouts were selected to balance content and UI and to foster familiarity.
apollon.ct.features.title: Features
apollon.ct.features.desc: Apollon Core and extra features used to manage your entire website.
apollon.ct.features.core.title: Core features
apollon.ct.features.core.desc: Core features used to manage main default WordPress components.
apollon.ct.features.theme.title: Theme features
apollon.ct.features.extra.title: Extra features
apollon.ct.features.searchform.title: Search forms
apollon.ct.features.searchform.desc: Turn on to display search forms.
apollon.ct.features.searchform.optimisat: Controls the type of content that displays in search results.
Turn on to limit the search to post titles only.
Number of search results per page
Controls the number of search results per page.
Turn on to enable live search results on menu search field and other fitting search forms.
apollon.ct.features.searchform.layout.he: Controls the layout for the search form on the header.
apollon.ct.features.searchform.layout.dr: The dropbar converts the classic dropdown to a full-width section.
apollon.ct.features.searchform.layout.pa: Controls the layout for the search results page.
apollon.ct.features.searchform.layout.po: Turn on to display allow user to choose a specific post type.
apollon.ct.features.searchform.layout.su: Turn on to display a submit button.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.title: Sidebars
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout1.mobi: Turn on to display sidebar on mobile.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout1.stic: Turn on to remain sidebar sticky when scrolling the page. If the sidebar content is taller than the screen, it acts like a normal sidebar until the bottom of the sidebar is within the viewport, which will then remain fixed in place as you scroll down.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout1.size: Choose the sidebar size, depending on your theme sizes.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout1.back: Choose the sidebar background color, depending on your theme colors.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout2.mobi: Turn on to display sidebar on mobile.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout2.stic: Turn on to remain sidebar sticky when scrolling the page. If the sidebar content is taller than the screen, it acts like a normal sidebar until the bottom of the sidebar is within the viewport, which will then remain fixed in place as you scroll down.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout2.size: Choose the sidebar size, depending on your theme sizes.
apollon.ct.features.sidebar.layout2.back: Choose the sidebar background color, depending on your theme colors.
apollon.ct.features.comments.title: Comments
apollon.ct.features.comments.desc: Turn on to display comments. This option is a global configuration.
apollon.ct.features.comments.optimisatio: Turn on to display author avatar.
Turn on to enable author website field.
Turn on to display HTML tags on comment field.
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.head: Comments header
Turn on to display comments header.
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.list: Controls the layout of the comments list.
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.form: Controls the layout of the comments form.
Turn on to display labels on top of controls.
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.labe: Turn on to display field labels.
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.high: Turn on to highlight author comments.
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.form: Choose where to display the comments form.
After the comments list and navs
Before the comments list and navs
apollon.ct.features.comments.layout.navs: Choose where to display the comments navs.
apollon.ct.features.social.title: Social share
apollon.ct.features.social.desc: Turn on to display a Social share buttons.
apollon.ct.features.social.icons.title: Icons
apollon.ct.features.backtotop.title: Back to top
apollon.ct.features.backtotop.desc: Turn on to display a Back to top button.
apollon.ct.features.backtotop.optimisati: Set a custom button label or leave it empty.
Set a custom button label or leave it empty.
Turn on to display button on mobile devices.
apollon.ct.features.backtotop.layout.pos: Controls the position of the button to be in the left, center or right of the site.
apollon.ct.features.backtotop.layout.sty: Controls the style of the button.
apollon.ct.features.pagination.title: Pagination
apollon.ct.features.pagination.optimisat: Turn on to display icons with navigation buttons.
Set the number of links to show at the beginning and the end of pagination.
Set the separator label to display between items.
Turn on to display numbers with navigation buttons.
apollon.ct.features.pagination.layout.te: Set the template to use to display pagination.
apollon.ct.features.pagination.layout.po: Controls the position of the pagination to be in the left, center or right of the site.
apollon.ct.features.pagination.layout.ti:
Use:
- %CURRENT% for the current page number
- %TOTAL% for the total number of pages
apollon.ct.features.pagination.layout.in: Turn on to display infinite scroll text label.
apollon.ct.features.nav.title: Horizontal navs
apollon.ct.features.nav.desc: Turn on to display horizontal navs.
apollon.ct.features.ads.title: Ads
apollon.ct.features.adblocker.title: Ad blocker popup
apollon.ct.header.title: Header
apollon.ct.header.nav.title: Navbars
apollon.ct.header.nav.menulabel.title: Menu label
apollon.ct.header.nav.shadow.title: Header shadow
apollon.ct.header.nav.shadow.desc: Controls the shadow of the global header.
apollon.ct.header.nav.sticky.title: Sticky
apollon.ct.header.nav.sticky.desc: Let the navbar sticks at the top of the viewport while scrolling or only when scrolling up.
apollon.ct.header.dropdown.title: Dropdowns
apollon.ct.header.dropdown.click.title: Click mode
apollon.ct.header.dropdown.click.desc: Turn on to enable clicking toggle on items with dropdown menu.
apollon.ct.header.dropdown.position.desc: Select the dropdown's alignment to the menu item or the navbar.
apollon.ct.header.navbars.title: Navbars options
apollon.ct.header.topnav.title: Top navbar
apollon.ct.header.topnav.desc: Define here your website's top navbar.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.enable.title: Top navbar
apollon.ct.header.topnav.enable.desc: Turn on to display the top navbar.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.contents.title: Navbar contents
apollon.ct.header.topnav.contents.conten: Define contents to set on left side.
Define contents to set on center side.
Define contents to set on right side.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.optimisation.mo: Turn on to display navbar on mobile.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.optimisation.st: Turn on to make navbar remains sticky.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.layout.title: Navbar layout
apollon.ct.header.topnav.layout.template: Controls the layout of the default format in list pages.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.layout.fullwidt: Turn on to display navbar on full width's website.
apollon.ct.header.topnav.layout.backgrou: Turn on to apply a background to the top navbar.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.title: Main navbar
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.desc: Define here your website's main navbar.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.enable.title: Main navbar
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.enable.desc: Turn on to display the main navbar.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.contents.title: Navbar contents
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.contents.conte: Define contents to set on left side.
Define contents to set on center side.
Define contents to set on right side.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.optimisation.m: Turn on to display navbar on mobile.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.optimisation.s: Turn on to make navbar remains sticky.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.layout.title: Navbar layout
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.layout.templat: Controls the layout of the default format in list pages.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.layout.fullwid: Turn on to display navbar on full width's website.
apollon.ct.header.mainnav.layout.backgro: Turn on to apply a background to the main navbar.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.title: Sub navbar
apollon.ct.header.subnav.desc: Define here your website's sub navbar.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.enable.title: Sub navbar
apollon.ct.header.subnav.enable.desc: Turn on to display the sub navbar.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.contents.title: Navbar contents
apollon.ct.header.subnav.contents.conten: Define contents to set on left side.
Define contents to set on center side.
Define contents to set on right side.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.optimisation.mo: Turn on to display navbar on mobile.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.optimisation.st: Turn on to make navbar remains sticky.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.layout.title: Navbar layout
apollon.ct.header.subnav.layout.template: Controls the layout of the default format in list pages.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.layout.fullwidt: Turn on to display navbar on full width's website.
apollon.ct.header.subnav.layout.backgrou: Turn on to apply a background to the sub navbar.
apollon.ct.layouts.title: Layouts
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.posttypes.title: Post types
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.posttypes.desc: Define post types to display in list pages.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.container.title: Container size
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.content.title: Content size
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.content.desc: Choose the content size, depending on your theme sizes.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.gridgap.title: Grid gap
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.gridgap.desc: Choose the gap size between contents.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.columns.title: Columns
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.columns.desc: Choose the number of columns of each row.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.feature.title: Feature block
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.feature.desc: Turn on to display a feature block with its contents.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.expand.title: Expand to header
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.expand.desc: Turn on to expand feature block under the main header.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.header.title: Feature block contents
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.header.desc: Choose which content to display in the feature block.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.elements.title: Contents
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.elements.desc: Choose which content to display and in which order.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.metas.title: Metas
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.metas.desc: Choose which meta content to display and in which order.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.coverpos.title: Cover position
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.coverpos.top: Positions the element at the top
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.coverpos.center: Positions the element vertically centered in the middle
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.coverpos.bottom: Positions the element at the bottom
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.avatar.title: Avatar
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.avatar.desc: Turn on to display author's avatar next to his name.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.template.title: Template
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.template.desc: Controls the layout in list pages.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.thumbnail.title: Thumbnail size
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.thumbnail.desc: Define thumbnail size to display in list pages.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.titletag.title: Title tag
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.titletag.desc: Define title HTML tag to use.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.excerpt.title: Excerpt
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.excerpt.desc: Define how many words to use to display the excerpt.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.usecontent.desc: Turn on to display content instead of excerpt.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.categorylink.de: Turn on to make categories linkables.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.readmoretitle.d: Define the read more button label.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.readmorestyle.d: Define the read more button style.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.readmoreicon.de: Turn on to display read more button icon.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.sidebarpos.desc: Choose the position of sidebars around the main content area.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.sidebars.title: Sidebars content
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.sidebars.desc: Turn on to use the same content than the default homepage sidebars.
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.list.title: Archive list
apollon.ct.layouts.cpt._.detail.title: Single page

apollon.ct.footer.title: Footer
apollon.ct.footer.section.title: %s section
apollon.ct.footer.section.enable.title: %s section
apollon.ct.footer.section.enable.desc: Turn on to display the %s section.
apollon.ct.footer.section.contents.title: Contents
apollon.ct.footer.section.contents.conte: Define contents to set on left side.
Define contents to set on left-center side.
Define contents to set on right-center side.
Define contents to set on right side.
apollon.ct.footer.section.layout.title: Layout
apollon.ct.footer.section.layout.fullwid: Turn on to display section on full width's website.
apollon.th.404.title: Oops! That page can't be found.
apollon.th.404.desc: It looks like nothing was found at this location. Maybe try a search?
apollon.th.comments.author: Name
apollon.th.comments.mustlogin: You must log in to comment.
apollon.th.comments.loggedas: You are logged in as %2$s. Log out ?
apollon.th.comments.before: Your email will not be displayed.
apollon.th.comments.after: You can use these <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr> tags: %s
apollon.th.comments.waiting: Your comment is awaiting for moderation.
